unnormalised: ## Automotive Buzz: Traffic Woes Getting a Thumbs Down?
normalised: Automotive Buzz: Traffic Woes Getting a Thumbs Down?

unnormalised: Bangalore's infamous traffic is back in the news! New regulations are being rolled out across the city, just in time for the Onam rush. Think stricter fines for signal jumping – we're talking potential fines reaching Rs. 5000, maybe even more!
normalised: Bangalore's infamous traffic is back in the news! New regulations are being rolled out across the city, just in time for the Onam rush. Think stricter fines for signal jumping – we're talking potential fines reaching rupee five thousand, maybe even more!

unnormalised: Word on the street is the authorities are cracking down on rash driving, especially around MG Road and Koramangala. Expect increased police presence and more CCTV cameras. They're even testing AI-powered systems to automatically detect violations.
normalised: Word on the street is the authorities are cracking down on rash driving, especially around M G Road and Koramangala. Expect increased police presence and more C C T V cameras. They're even testing A I-powered systems to automatically detect violations.

unnormalised: "We're hoping this will make the roads safer for everyone, especially during the festive season," says a traffic official from the Indian Institute of Traffic Management.
normalised: "We're hoping this will make the roads safer for everyone, especially during the festive season," says a traffic official from the Indian Institute of Traffic Management.

unnormalised: But many are worried if these rules will be effective or just another headache like finding parking in Commercial Street. After all, Bangaloreans are known for their 'jugaad' when it comes to traffic!
normalised: But many are worried if these rules will be effective or just another headache like finding parking in Commercial Street. After all, Bangaloreans are known for their 'jugaad' when it comes to traffic!

unnormalised: Reports also suggest the speed limit on the Outer Ring Road might be reduced from 80 kmph to 60 kmph.
normalised: Reports also suggest the speed limit on the Outer Ring Road might be reduced from eighty kilometer per hour to sixty kilometer per hour.

unnormalised: Will these changes help us reach our biryani dinner on time? Only time will tell! Buckle up, folks, it’s going to be a bumpy ride, literally and figuratively. Let’s hope this is more than just chai pe charcha!
normalised: Will these changes help us reach our biryani dinner on time? Only time will tell! Buckle up, folks, it’s going to be a bumpy ride, literally and figuratively. Let’s hope this is more than just chai pe charcha!
